intro: Krynitzkia scripta, commonly known as the script lichen, is a species of lichen that belongs to the family Lecanoraceae. It is characterized by its foliose thallus, which is typically bright green to yellowish in color. The plant forms a symbiotic relationship between a fungus and a green alga, which allows it to thrive on rock surfaces in arid environments. It is often found in Mediterranean regions, where it grows on limestone and other calcareous substrates. Due to its slow growth and sensitivity to environmental changes, it is considered an indicator species for ecological health.
